entry.title: Armenia‚Äôs foreign trade approaching $18.5B: THIS WEEK IN BUSINESS

media:group.media:title: Armenia‚Äôs foreign trade approaching $18.5B: THIS WEEK IN BUSINESS
media:group.media:description:
üìç Armenia‚Äôs foreign trade in the first half of the year more than doubled to approach $18.5 billion, fueled largely by booming business with Russia and the United Arab Emirates. üìç Armenia‚Äôs top exports last year were gold, diamonds, and mobile phones, in the latest sign the country‚Äôs re-export trade with Russia is continuing to reorder the economies. üìç Inside Armenia‚Äôs economic reform agenda with Hovsep Patvakanyan: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=s3gkmdAoOT0
Credits: Ruptly

media:group.media:title: Government to compensate employers for hiring Artsakh Armenians
media:group.media:description:
üìç India intends to begin shipping surface-to-air mobile missile systems to Armenia later this year, the Indian Defense Research Wing news site reported. üìç The Armenian government will begin providing financial support to employers who hire those forcibly displaced from Artsakh. üìç Armenia‚Äôs National Olympic Committee filed an appeal with the International Olympic Committee protesting wrestler Artur Aleksanyan‚Äôs gold medal loss this week. üìç Insights with Eric Hacopian: https://youtu.be/4GPG3A6n0nQ

entry.title: Azerbaijan drops demand for extraterritorial corridor from normalization talks

media:group.media:title: Azerbaijan drops demand for extraterritorial corridor from normalization talks
media:group.media:description:
üìç Azerbaijan has dropped its demand for Armenia to open an extraterritorial corridor from normalization talks, a special representative of President Ilham Aliyev announced. üìç Azerbaijan withdrew from a military post within Armenian territory near the village of Berkaber in the Tavush region, the village‚Äôs mayor said. üìç European Union observers visited the village of Nerkin Hand in the Syunik region for the first time since the withdrawal of Russian troops from the area earlier this summer. üìç Two athletes representing Armenia in Greco-Roman wrestling each won a medal at the Paris Olympics, bringing the country‚Äôs total medal count to three. üìç Op-ed by Vartan Oskanian: Armenia must redefine its national interests: ‚Äã‚Äãhttps://shorturl.at/Wsakn

media:group.media:title: Armenia's 120,000 reasons to recognize Palestine
media:group.media:description:
In this week‚Äôs episode of CivilNet‚Äôs Insights series, host Eric Hacopian discusses Azerbaijan‚Äôs decision last month to sentence Nagorno-Karabakh Armenian Rashid Beglaryan to 15 years in prison, Armenia‚Äôs latest round of joint military drills with the United States, and Armenia‚Äôs historic recognition of Palestine.
